intro: Stenaria nigricans, commonly known as the black-stemmed stenaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Stenaria nigricans is often found in swampy areas and is considered an indicator species for wetland habitats.
